info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 9 at 11:58AM AKST until November 9 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...INCOMING STORM BRINGING HEAVY SNOW TO THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE HIGHWAYS...
.A low pressure system moving northward will bring heavy snow to the northern panhandle through Sunday. Snow has started to fall on the highways with White Pass, and all of the Haines Highway seeing snow fall since around midnight Saturday night. Forecast confidence remains high of significant snow accumulations along the Klondike Highway and Haines Highway, including White Pass and Haines Customs. As of 1130am Sunday the cities of Haines and Skagway have seen snow mix down to the surface, with reports of 3 to 5 inches on the ground in the area of Haines. Northerly flow continues to reinforce the cooler air and support snow, however as the low tracks north, a southerly push of wind Sunday afternoon will ultimately switch the snow to rain for most low elevation areas. By Sunday afternoon, precipitation rates will diminish as the system begins to depart, and its southerly push of warmer air arrives in the northern panhandle.
* WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches.
* WHERE...Klondike Highway.
* WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening.
* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and is discouraged unless it is an emergency.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Forecast confidence is high in significant accumulating snowfall along the Klondike Highway, with totals of up to 18 inches expected, highest amounts near White Pass. Forecast challenge for this system remains the amount of snowfall that will reach the surface at sea-level near Skagway and when the surface winds will shift out of the south.
info.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING
